intro: Hackelia pinetorum var. jonesii, commonly known as Jones' firecracker, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and rocky slopes, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
